column2: ENGLISH
Protectorate
Protectorates
Protector
§MED-T: Force Protectorate§!
Force [Root.GetHerHim] to become our Protectorate.
§MED-T: Offer Protectorate§!
Offer [Root.GetHerHim] the chance to become our Protectorate.
Dissolve Protectorate
Our so-called protector can no longer protect us, so they are no longer our suzerain!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] has a powerful neighbour who follows a different religion.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is at war - but not with [Root.GetHerHis] suzerain, and not on the same side as [Root.GetHerHis] suzerain
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has a significantly bigger army than [Root.GetTitledFirstName].
[From.GetTitledFirstName] can NOT force [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to be their protectorate. (Tip: Use the "Force Protectorate" interaction instead.)
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is unlanded or not independent
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] is unlanded or not independent or is a tributary
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] is Duke-tier or higher, and [From.GetTitledFirstName] granted [Root.GetHerHim] a title of that tier
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] CANNOT immediately break the protectorate relationship with [From.GetTitledFirstName] due to non-independence of one or both parties
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] CANNOT immediately break the protectorate relationship with [From.GetTitledFirstName] due to relative prestige and/or army size
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has §Yless than -100§! prestige and [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has §Ymore than 100§! prestige.
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has slightly less prestige than [Root.GetTitledFirstName] - specifically:
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has significantly less prestige than [Root.GetTitledFirstName] - specifically:
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has significantly more prestige than [Root.GetTitledFirstName] - specifically:
Never - This condition is invalid because [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has too much prestige
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has less than §Y25%§! of the troops of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] (as measured by "Total Levy" values in the Realm Tree window)
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has less than §Y50%§! of the troops of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] (as measured by "Total Levy" values in the Realm Tree window)
[Prev.GetTitledFirstName] has less than §Y80%§! of the troops of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] (as measured by "Total Levy" values in the Realm Tree window)
Has a more powerful neighbour of a different religion
Has a significantly more powerful neighbour of a different religion
Has an overwhelmingly more powerful neighbour of a different religion
Losing a defensive war
Badly losing a defensive war
Defending against a powerful aggressor
Defending against a significantly more powerful aggressor
